{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38710].
  {panel}

h3. Current behaviour

If another user @mentions you in a page or comment you will receive a mail notification.

h3. Expected behaviour

Make this notification an optative choice in the User profile so the user can choose if he wants to receive this notification or not.
fields.summary: Turn off mail notifications for @mentions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38708].
  {panel}

The Atlassian SDK atlas-create* commands do not trim spaces from class names. This results in a skeleton plugin with broken imports and packages. The error message in the IDE recommends to fix this issue by refactoring the class "from  a.b.c to a.b.c", which looks redundant to a human reader. At second look, I see it was generated with illegal whitespace in the code, and in directory names.

I likely introduced the spaces into the wizard by copying and pasting the groupId and artifactId etc from another terminal window (e.g. selected an extra space before the groupId by accident). I assume the same problem can also happen at all other steps, e.g. where we rename MyServlet.java. 

No class or package can start with space anyway. Atlas-create* should just trim it, and not generate a needlessly broken skeleton. 

Examples of inconsistencies:

* MyPluginComponent.java and MyPluginComponentImpl.java start with "package  too.many.spaces;" 
* pom.xml says: "<groupId>too.many.spaces</groupId>"
* atlassian-plugin.xml says: <component key="myPluginComponent" class=" too.many.spaces.MyPluginComponentImpl" public="true"><interface>too.many.spaces.MyPluginComponent</interface></component>
* atlassian-plugin.xml says: <servlet name="My Servlet" i18n-name-key="my-servlet.name" key="my-servlet" class="too.many.spaces.servlet.MyServlet">
* Also the test files have spaces in package and import.
* Extra whitespace in directory names such as " just-testing".

Reproduce:

{{C:\Users\someone\TEST>atlas-create-confluence-plugin
[...]
Define value for groupId: :  too.many.spaces
Define value for artifactId: :  just-testing
Define value for version:  1.0-SNAPSHOT: :
Define value for package:   too.many.spaces: :
Confirm properties configuration:
groupId:  too.many.spaces
artifactId:  just-testing
version: 1.0-SNAPSHOT
package:  too.many.spaces
 Y: : Y
[...]
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
C:\Users\someone\TEST>cd " just-testing"
C:\Users\someone\TEST\ just-testing>atlas-create-confluence-plugin-module
[...]
[INFO] --- maven-confluence-plugin:5.0.13:create-plugin-module (default-cli) @ just-testing ---
Choose Plugin Module: 
[...]
[INFO] Adding the following items to the project:
[INFO]   [class: it.too.many.spaces.servlet.MyServletFuncTest]
[INFO]   [class: too.many.spaces.servlet.MyServlet]
[INFO]   [class: ut.too.many.spaces.servlet.MyServletTest]
[...]
[INFO] BUILD SUCCESS
C:\Users\someone\TEST\ just-testing>
}}
fields.summary: Atlassian SDK keeps illegal whitespace in package names

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38701].
  {panel}

I have copied some of the comments from CONF-29116, since this issue is resolved and there are no response on comments regarding children and current page.

CQL doesn't currently offer a resolution to this use case since it allows you to specify a specific ancestor or parent rather than the current page as the ancestor or parent. This means that you have to specify a specific page name, so it can't be used when creating templates. What's needed is the equivalent of the Space function currentSpace() to allow users to specify that the page on which the macro appears is the intended ancestor/parent, e.g. ancestor = currentPage().

It should be possible to use this in a template by (i.e.) adding @self as the ancestor value.

Page Properties Report should replace Matadata Report, since this macro is no longer supported. Metadata Report plugin which had this functionality and led to very useful templates. Everything that was possible with Metadata Plugin ver. 1 should be possible in Page Properties Report.
fields.summary: Page Properties Report with current page as parent

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38684].
  {panel}

h3. Problem 

We run into this problem quite often. When we print we want to print the page precisely as it currently looks. (i.e With Expand macros all collapsed, or some collapsed and some expanded).

At the moment the page just prints as though all the Expands are expanded.  Not useful!

As a work around we have to Duplicate the page, remove the expands, save and print.  It means we always have to maintain a 2ndary copy of some articles with empty Expand macros.

Exporting to PDF is not a viable option either because the PDF rendering isn't WYSIWYG either; the images for example are all printed at 100% size, not at the size we've specified in the page.
fields.summary: Feature Request: Option to NOT expand {expand} macros when printing page.
Fully functioning PDFs
Print function on the attachment preview screen.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38677].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to replicate

# create a new planner on a document 
# switch to week view
# add bars of one or two weeks length extending to the 11-12 week mark
# save the macro & the page

h3. Results

The bars around the 11 week mark overlap even though they did not in the planning stage.
!roadmapplannermacro.png|thumbnail!

h3. Expected Results

None of the bars overlap.
fields.summary: Roadmap Planner Macro does not display data properly in some views

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38672].
  {panel}

Live on master at the moment.

Usernames with "+" in currently cause a error when clicking the link to the user's profile - it goes to a URL like this, which gives a 404:

https://nclarke.jira-dev.com/wiki/display/~nclarke%2B1

These usernames are legal from LDAP and are created by Cloud user management for email addresses like "nclarke+1@atlassian.com"

[~jxie] says this needs fixing here:
https://stash.atlassian.com/projects/CONF/repos/confluence/browse/confluence-core/confluence/src/java/com/atlassian/confluence/servlet/simpledisplay/SimpleDisplayServlet.java#53
fields.summary: Usernames with "+" result in broken profile links
Abigail Marlene Mansour

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38668].
  {panel}

The constraint {{cp_unique_user_groups unique}}  which will check the unique of the following combination of column  (cps_id, cp_type, username, groupname) in content_perm maximun size exceed 900 byte.

The username and groupname uses the nvchar type with the size  (255). Even if we calculate the groupname and username column alone, it would result in 1024 byte (The storage size of nvchar in bytes, is two times the actual length of data entered + 2 bytes)  of storage space which already exceeded the allowed the allowed [maximun size of index key length|https://technet.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms191241(v=sql.105).aspx],

 
h3. Possible workaround:
Decrease the size of the groupname and username to 100.
fields.summary: Confluence 'cp_unique_user_groups' has  a maximum value bigger than 900 bytes which is not recommend in MS SQL Server.

{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38660].
  {panel}

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Create a page. The title contain Ampersand and Quote. Eg: 
{code}
Cake & Ice Cream lalala's
{code}
# Mark the page as Favourite
# Go to Favourite Pages in Dashboard
!FavouritePages.png!

h3. Characters affected:
# Ampersand "&"
# Single Quote " ' "
fields.summary: Favourite Page Does Not Render Special Character Correctly
Allow Content Blueprints to create child pages
404 from "Confluence Use Case FAQ's"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38652].
  {panel}

Links to restricted pages are displayed differently, depending on how they are inserted into a page. 

To a user who is restricted from a page that is linked to, the link displays different behavior depending on how it's inserted into the page. 

When the link is inserted as a web link, the user sees a clickable link that will redirect to a "No Permission" page (see [^no-permission.png]).

When the link is inserted via "Recently Viewed" or Search", the link is greyed out and "unclickable"  in that it simply links to "#" (see [^link-display.png]). For these, it would be better for the user if the link redirected to the "No Permission" page, or at the very least displayed some sort of message that the page is restricted from them. Without those, it seems as if the link is broken.

h4. Steps to Reproduce

# Create a page that is restricted to UserB
# On an unrestricted page, create two links to the restricted page, one using the "web link" and one using "search"
# Log in as UserB
# Click each of the links on the unrestricted page
fields.summary: Redirect to "No Permission" on links to restricted pages

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38644].
  {panel}

as per the summary, it would be great if all users will be able to reply to the user directly that have triggered the email notification.

current behavior : the "from" email address is the mailserver email address instead of the sender email address

desired behavior : preferably the "from" email address is the sender's email address so that other users can directly reply to the sender (the user that trigger the mail notification)
immediately from the mail client itself.
fields.summary: the receiver of the mail notification should be able to directly reply the user that trigger the email
The ability to disable email notification for a single user

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38637].
  {panel}

h3. Problem Definition
As an administrator, I am not able to modify the default warning messages in the Confluence Viewfile Macro. 

h3. Suggested Solution
It would be beneficial to allow administrators to edit the text in these front end warnings to accommodate business process or provide more context on the warning/error for end users.
fields.summary: Allow Editing of Front End Warning Messages for the Confluence Viewfile Macro

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38636].
  {panel}

***Summary***
Attachment "Download All" feature does not download attachments with Chinese Characters in IE. Verified on IE 11.

***Steps to Reproduce***
# Upload attachments with Chinese Characters in the name
# Download a normal attachment
# *Download All* attachments in the page
# The document(s) with the chinese character will not be downloaded
fields.summary: Attachment "Download All" does not download attachments with Chinese Characters in IE

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38633].
  {panel}

h3. Summary
@User Mention feature does not work when selecting it from the "Insert" function in Chrome


h3. Environment
* Chrome

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit a page
# Click Insert > @ User mention
# a @ will appear 
# insert the desired username

h3. Expected Results
The desired username is typed and displayed, upon pressing (enter) the desired user is mentioned

h3. Actual Results
The text cursor was not focused right after "@" character and nothing gets typed out.
 
h3. Notes
* Works well in Internet Explorer and Firefox
* Replicated in versions:
** 5.9-OD (Cloud)
** 1000.1580.0 (Cloud)
** 5.8.6
** 5.7.3

h3.Workaround
Use other method such as typing '@' before typing out the username
fields.summary: Insert > User Mention does not work in Chrome

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38615].
  {panel}

We had a situation where a user commented on a jira issue with a text 25MB comment. This was sent as a workbox notification to Confluence, which promptly died trying to sanitise the string:

{code}
2015-07-24 00:35:17,952 ERROR [catalina-exec-33] [common.error.jersey.ThrowableExceptionMapper] toResponse Uncaught exception thrown by REST service: Java heap space

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38592].
  {panel}

First of all: yes, we can use the "copy page" function and then delete content not necessary.
But: unwillingly this is not how a user works. Most of the content-writer likes to / are addicted to use C'n'P (Ctrl-C / Ctrl-V).

Old {{\{section}}} and {{\{row}}}/{{\{column}}} macros had a big advantage: layouted Content was able to be copied selective.

so: It would be great to get a possibility, to "copy selection including applied layout"

Might be implemented as:
* copy a single section from a page with all columns
* Ctrl-A not just selects the active layout column content but the complete page

Current known "workarounds": (not applicable to "normal" users!)
* use labs source editor plugin https://marketplace.atlassian.com/plugins/com.atlassian.confluence.plugins.editor.confluence-source-editor
* edit / copy content via WebDAV

P.S: hope this is no duplicate, but can't even find any matching issue
fields.summary: Copy and paste (partial) page content including layouts

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38589].
  {panel}

(from Natalie's [comment|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-34326?focusedCommentId=766444&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels:comment-tabpanel#comment-766444] in CONF-34326)

In the CQL UI Space picker the user is given the option of "Current space" which creates underlying CQL like "space = currentSpace()", but for the Content picker there is no corresponding "Current content" that creates CQL like "parent = currentContent()".

Given that the currently-active content is already in the same internal Context object used to resolve the currentSpace() function, it should be easy enough to create the "currentContent()" function.

Then, in the UI, a "Current content" option could appear at the top of the "Suggested pages" list when a user triggers the Content picker.
fields.summary: CQL UI for Content picker should include "Current page"

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38547].
  {panel}

Premier Client has been hitting an error: "unable to parse gadget feed" when attempting to subscribe to the full gadget feed for their instance. When subscribing to individual gadgets, they work without issue, but the entire feed could *not* be added.

Trying a curl request provided some additional information:
{code}WARNING: cannot verify sjc04d1jraap01.teslamotors.com’s certificate, issued by “/C=US/O=Tesla Motors Inc./CN=Tesla Motors Corp Issuing CA”:
Unable to locally verify the issuer’s authority. {code}
And a little more here:
{code}curl: (60) Peer certificate cannot be authenticated with known CA certificates
More details here: http://curl.haxx.se/docs/sslcerts.html
curl performs SSL certificate verification by default, using a "bundle"
of Certificate Authority (CA) public keys (CA certs). If the default
bundle file isn't adequate, you can specify an alternate file
using the --cacert option.
If this HTTPS server uses a certificate signed by a CA represented in
the bundle, the certificate verification probably failed due to a
problem with the certificate (it might be expired, or the name might
not match the domain name in the URL).
If you'd like to turn off curl's verification of the certificate, use
the -k (or --insecure) option. {code}
This makes me think that the either the Certificate in use was not valid, or it was missing a certificate in the chain.

The screen message just said that the "gadget feed URL cannot be parsed" and nothing more. It would be nice if we could gather additional information about the reason that it can not be parsed for our client.
fields.summary: Gadget Feed ERROR message needs improvement
Expand option for Attachment Macro

{panel:title=Update|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#3C78B5| titleBGColor=#3C78B5| bgColor=#E7F4FA}
The fix has been rolled out to all instances. If you had switched back to the Default Theme you can safely return to the Documentation theme. If you're still affected by this problem please [contact Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com]
{panel}


h3. Summary
After the maintenance of 20 July 2015 the Documentation theme of Confluence is broken and shows the menu/side bar of a space at the top.

h3. Environment
Confluence Cloud Only.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Switch Confluence to the Documentation theme

h3. Expected Results
The Page tree is shown on the left hand side

h3. Actual Results
The page tree is shown up top instead.
!documentation.png!
 

h3.Workaround
Switch to the Default Confluence Theme Globally. Certain spaces may need to be configured to use the global theme afterward.
fields.summary: Documentation theme sidebar shown at the top of the page instead of at the side.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38495].
  {panel}

For reasons that aren't immediately obvious, the workday plugin has a direct dependency on the quartz scheduler.

1. This is going to be a showstopper in JIRA 7.0, because the quartz scheduler isn't going to be exported by JIRA core anymore.  If it really needs scheduling, it will have to use {{atlassian-scheduler-api}} or be happy with SAL.
2. I don't understand why it has this dependency at all.  It doesn't seem to be doing anything with it, and the version it specifies in its top-level pom is 2.1.2, which isn't what either JIRA or Confluence exports.

P.S.: I couldn't find a component that seemed relevant for Workday and you wouldn't let me submit without one, so I picked BugFix Team.
fields.summary: Workday plugin has a direct dependency on quartz
When adding a new restriction, the button appears to be disabled

  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Cloud*. Using *Confluence Server*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFSERVER-38493].
  {panel}

At least these builds are missing from the R5.8 builds:
* A2. OnDemand Release Selenium Tests (Java 8, Tomcat 6) OD À la carte [here|https://collaboration-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/chain/result/viewChainResult.action?planKey=COD-MASTP&buildNumber=566]
* A4. Master UI Selenium, Firefox 31, Documentation Theme (Java 6) [here|https://collaboration-bamboo.internal.atlassian.com/browse/CONFUI-SELENIUMFF36DOCUMENTATION14] (though this should be Java 8 for us)

We should also check and confirm that there are no other builds that are missing.
